oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Some Bushman children advised by their parents to be self-reliant in seeking food, in order to prepare themselves for the loss of their natural protectors. Related by Dia!kwain (L V.-6. 4404-4411 rev.-4413 rev.). This advice includes the waiting and watching for porcupine and other teachings relating to 'great things'. This is 'not a little story', but a 'great story', and is the story of the porcupine. 1) pp.4404v-4407v: see Things girls and youths must avoid (the rain's things), 2) This story is found in Book V-6.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Parents instruct children how to get food, or, How D.H's father and mother instructed their children to get food
